name: Naku Weed
desc: Even on windless days, this plant will tremble lightly amid the cries of thunder. The parts of it that resemble petals are in fact extensions of the leaves meant to protect the fragile flower.

customize.name: Naku Weed Seed
customize.desc: A seed obtained from the Seed Dispensary. A quality seed full of life, just waiting to be planted in the fields of the Realm Within. After some time, it will grow into a Naku Weed.

customize.name: Aoi
customize.desc: A shopkeeper who owns Tsukumomono Groceries. She sells cooking ingredients that are often used in Inazuma dishes.

customize.name: Mora
customize.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

customize.name: Babak
customize.desc: A researcher and the manager of the largest imported goods shop in Port Ormos. It is under the direct management of the Akademiya.

customize.name: Mora
customize.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

customize.name: Yoimiya
customize.desc: Owner of Naganohara Fireworks. Known as "Queen of the Summer Festival," she excels in her craft of creating fireworks that symbolize people's hopes and dreams.

customize.name: Kuki Shinobu
customize.desc: The capable and reliable deputy leader of the "Arataki Gang." Please note: capable and reliable are not appellations for the "Arataki Gang," but for their deputy leader in specific.

customize.name: Electroculus Resonance Stone
customize.desc:
A stone that can be used in Inazuma to search for nearby Electroculi.
This strange device can resonate with Electro Statues of The Seven. Due to this trait, it can detect the presence of Electroculi.
Across the span of endless years, even the most majestic cities and sculptures would be worn down by wind and rain, and even the power of Statues of The Seven would gradually dissipate. But this faded strength would coalesce once more into the Oculi, which call out wordlessly to their Statues.

customize.name: Mora
customize.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

customize.name: Naku Weed
customize.desc: Even on windless days, this plant will tremble lightly amid the cries of thunder. The parts of it that resemble petals are in fact extensions of the leaves meant to protect the fragile flower.

customize.name: Sakura Bloom
customize.desc: Blossoms from the Sacred Sakura at the Grand Narukami Shrine, filled with a fondness for Inazuma.

customize.name: Amethyst Lump
customize.desc: An uncut crystal that can only be found in Inazuma. Some professional craftsmanship will bring out its true value.

value.text:
Found in the wild
Recommendation: Found in Tatarasuna
